poem:
"Chaos in Wembley's Hallowed Ground"

Oh, for the dance of the beautiful game,
thrust into shadow by folly and shame,
More than a miss from Saka's brave boot,
the unruly throng of a ticketless loot.
A mirthless jest turned to grim affray,
Stewards and spectators in the fray.
In the cathedral of football, disharmony reigned,
On a day when the sport we love was stained.
